intro: Quamoclit coccinea var. hederifolia, commonly known as the scarlet glorybower, is a vibrant flowering plant native to South America. It features striking red-orange bracts that resemble flowers, which are actually modified leaves. The plant has a trailing growth habit and produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for containers and hanging baskets. Its botanical appeal lies in its bold, colorful foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
